cities.name: Berlín
cities.description: The German capital has a great story to tell its visitors. Devastated during the Second World War and divided by the Wall for 28 years, Berlin recovers its former splendor with giant steps. The buildings of modern architecture erase with large brushstrokes the dark past of the city, creating a special atmosphere where the classic mixes with the modern and the extravagant with the everyday. The traces of the wall form the best of museums in which times of anguish due to division can be relived, the concentration camps expose their best kept secrets about the consequences of an exacerbated fascism and the bunkers transmit the terror that one day kept the city hidden by fear.

cities.name: London
cities.description: London is an exciting city, with a unique atmosphere, a mix between the most traditional of the English and the modernity of a city at the forefront, but without forgetting the heritage of the British Empire, which has led to a cultural mix in this city that will will surprise you at every corner.

cities.name: Moscow
cities.description: In Moscow there is much more to see than the Kremlin or Red Square. Its wonderful religious architecture, busy shopping areas, vibrant pubs and restaurants, and fantastic green spaces make a visit to this city an amazing and unforgettable experience. Although Moscow was once one of the most expensive cities in the world, today it is much more convenient for travelers.

cities.name: Washington
cities.description: While there are many reasons to visit Washington, for each one some may or may not be valid. You should know, however, that it is a diverse destination, which makes it accessible and interesting for all types of travelers. Washington offers plenty of things to see and experiences to have, which also makes it an appropriate destination for tourists of all ages.

cities.name: Seoul
cities.description: In Seoul, sightseeing will allow you to see some of the most impressive buildings and monuments in Asia. The Korean capital is full of palaces and temples that exude a charming oriental essence. But it is also a modern and global city, with towering skyscrapers that shade the centuries-old buildings. To start getting to know Seoul, you should visit one of its palaces. In total, in the Korean capital there are up to five palaces that were built by the Joseon dynasty, which ruled Korea from 1392 until the beginning of the 20th century.

cities.name: Tokyo
cities.description: Hablar de Tokio (東京), significa hablar a lo grande. Es una ciudad tan inmensa en tamaño, arquitectónica y culturalmente, que sobrepasa a cualquiera. Y es que resulta fácil perderse en esta maravillosa ciudad por la cantidad de oferta que dispone.

cities.name: Rome
cities.description: With a long and interesting history behind it, Rome is a city that attracts visitors from all over the world thanks to its impressive monuments and archaeological remains from Antiquity. There are countless reasons to visit Rome, fall in love with the city and want to return to it. The gastronomy and its lively atmosphere are some of them.

cities.name: París
cities.description: Paris, one of the most beautiful cities in the world, seduces first of all for its exceptional architectural and cultural heritage. A living heritage, which continues to be modernized and enriched. Paris is also the capital of gastronomy, fashion and shopping; A city where something always happens.

cities.name: Beijing
cities.description: Beijing is the capital of the People's Republic of China and makes up the cultural, political and social heart of the country. It is a vibrant and chaotic city in constant evolution that develops by leaps and bounds while struggling to maintain its traditional character. Beijing is a city of contrasts where modern skyscrapers stand tall alongside small traditional houses nestled in the city's old hutongs.

cities.name: Mexico City
cities.description: Mexico City is known as the Cultural Capital of America, it is one of the richest and most fascinating destinations in the world, not only because it is one of the three main cities with the largest number of museums, it also combines a historical legacy, full of flavor thanks to its varied gastronomic offer, recognized by lovers of local, traditional and great international fusion food.

cities.name: Brasilia
cities.description: Brasilia, the capital of Brazil, is a city with abundant parks and natural reserves, which is why it is called the Green City; This is the guide to Brasilia where you can get to know the great city with a lot of cultural and historical attractions for tourists. Walking through Brasilia you will visit the Metropolitan Cathedral of Nossa Senhora Aparecida, the Itamari Congress, and more.

cities.name: Buenos Aires
cities.description: The Autonomous City of Buenos Aires is the capital of the Argentine Republic. The waters of the Río de la Plata bathe its coast and make it the political and economic center of the country. It is the second largest urban region in South America. Buenos Aires is a city that is always on the move. Its cultural facet is reflected in the large number and variety of museums, theaters, art galleries and libraries.

cities.name: Montevideo
cities.description: The city of Montevideo is the capital of Uruguay and is located in the center-south of the country. It has the charms of modernity and progress, as well as the bohemia and history that can be breathed along its streets. With a moderately temperate climate, without intense cold or heat, it presents numerous alternatives for walks, entertainment venues and shows for all tastes and expectations.

cities.name: Bogota
cities.description: Bogotá is the capital and the largest city of Colombia. It is a convergence point for people from all over the country, so it is diverse and multicultural, and it combines the old and the modern. If you want to travel to Colombia, surely you are wondering where is Bogotá located? Well, the country's capital has a privileged location, it is in the midst of abundant vegetation that achieves one of the most beautiful green landscapes on the continent. It is in the center of Colombian territory, in the Cundiboyacense highlands and on the savannah that bears the same name. The city is part of the Andean region, one of the six regions of the country.

cities.name: San Salvador
cities.description: The capital of El Salvador, San Salvador, is a modern city of wide boulevards and narrow streets, open-air markets, government buildings, tall towers, monuments, exuberant nightlife, museums, and other cultural institutions. And all this with the San Salvador volcano as a backdrop. The city is surrounded by slums as well as affluent suburbs with restaurants and large shopping malls. Peaceful settings, such as the Parque Cuscutlán botanical garden, provide a break from the hectic pace of the city.
